instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message:
another board with liquide damage no green light before replaced smc 

green light ok after replaced smc 
power on for 2 seconde and stop start 2 seconde and stop loop

I have replaced smc twice and same problem pubs_g3h 12,56V and pp3v42_g3h 3,42V and green light OK 

possible problem with SPI ?

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: Clock chip seems like a good suspect

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message:
how to check 
U2600 problem  ?

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message:
you need a scope, or just replace it. 
Whats u6100 area like ?

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: u6100 corroded, cleaned area and checked resistance arround same problem

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: U2600 replaced? Checked traces from U6100? Remove U6100 and measure diode mode on all pins.

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: U2600 not replaced i will Check diode mode on all pins of U6100

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message:
PP3V3_SUS line voltage up 1,5v and decrease a 0,8V loop, possible problem with U7200 (area very clean) ?

PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS 12,59V

P5VS3_EN_L 3,46V stable and P3V3S5_EN_L 0V at Q7221 pin 2 and 5

PP5V_S3 3,3V up and decrease

PP3V3_S5 3,3V up and decrease

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: Diode mode values are off. Check traces and continuity from U6100 to all termination resistors. R5110 and friends.

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: checked continuity from u6100 to all termination resistor r510 and friends all good :/

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: Diode mode on pin 1 of R5110 and on pin 2 of R5120?

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message:
Diode mode

Pin1 of r5110 1,129
pin2 of r5120 1,192

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: That just can't be right, that line goes straight to PCH. Do you have red on GND?

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message:
Yes read on GND sorry 

on pin1 of R5110 to pin2 R5120 in diode mode i've 0,109

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: Need all values again on U6100 pins without U6100 installed.

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message:
without U6100 installed on pins of U6100 :
diode mode

1: 1.190v
2: 0.830v
3: 2.288v
4: 0.002v
5: 1.202v
6: 0.881v
7: 0.894v
8: 0.572v

and resistance : 

1: 2.561mohm
2: 2.466mohm
3: 29.76kohm
4: 0.001ohm
5: 2.404mohm
6: 2.424mohm
7: 148.4kohm
8: 25.98kohm

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message:
I have no idea how you are measuring this or what multimeter you are using, but 1.190 on diode mode makes no sense at all. These lines go straight into the PCH and should have something in the .400 to .700 range. Got a donor board to compare with?
Also have you replaced the clock chip now?

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message:
for diode mode, black probe GND and red probe to pins of u6100 that's it ?
reverse ,red probe GND and black probe to pins i have diode mode gets :
1: 0,675
2: 0,611
3: 2,240
4: 0,002
5: 0,680
6: 0,681
7: 0,681
8: 0,450

not replaced clock chip , I must replace U2600 ?
i've not donor with PCH present for compare

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message:
It is standard practice in diode mode to have red on GND...Those readings look fine.
Replace U2600 first.

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: U2600 replace same problem

R7403 150Kohm

threads.message:
ALL_SYS_PWRGD resistance to GND 21.23K and voltage increase and decrease 0V and 3V loop

ALL_SYS_PWRGD_R 0V and resistance to ground OL

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: At this point I am out of ideas besides crap under the PCH or corroded trace or resistor somewhere.

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: reflow PCH maybe ? found broken line at J5100 area (restored with wire)

threads.title: 820-3115 fan fan spin 3 seconde
threads.message: It's corrosion somewhere, no way I can point you to it over the internet. Inspect and maybe reflow.
